creditline: Gift of the John C. Weber Collection
description: square black lacquer box (a) with design on lid (b) of 3 scattered Unsun karuta (Japanese playing cards in Portuguese style) in gold and silver takamaki-e on a black ground; underside of lid showing farmers transplanting rice seedlings under an inlaid gold crescent moon on a speckled nashiji ground; fitted in the lower interior with an implement tray (c) depicting 5 rice farmers; inkstone (d) fitted in lacquer frame; and cloisonne enamel on brass water dropper (e) in trefoil leaf shape that fits into shaped cavity in inkstone frame; double storage boxes in natural wood; inner box with lid, ivory colored silk storage bag, and leather tie; outer box with lid, tan paper cover and black box tie
markings: paper card inside storage box: [Japanese] / Writing box. / Edo Period (1615-1867). / Wood, lacquered, with maki-e / (gold lacquer). Design of / un-sun karuta (playing / cards).
signed: inkstone signed on base: Tenkaichi Sugimoto Toyo [illeg]
title: Writing box with unsun card design
